noun.description: A dishonest trader or pedlar, especially of clothes or handkerchiefs; specifically one who dupes others into buying inferior goods for a high price.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in Whitehall Evening Post. From dud + -er<br>mid 17th century; earliest use found in William Rowley (?1585–1626), actor and playwright. Apparently a variant of didder.
